Table of Contents

Name

henyey - search for periodic orbits in a potential (Henyey’s method)

Synopsis

henyey [parameter=value]

Description

henyey computes periodic orbits using the Henyey method of searching for periodic solutions of a system of differential equations in an (optionally rotating) 2D potential.

The method has been used first by T.S. v. Albada & R.H. Sanders (1982) MNRAS, 201, 303. For more details see also: Henyey et al.(1964) ApJ 139, 309

The method originated from the same equations as looking for solutions of pulsation stars (RR Lyr, Cepheids). See e.g. van Albada and Baker (1971)

Parameters

The following parameters are recognized in order; they may be given in any order if the keyword is also given. Use --help to confirm this man page is up to date.
x0=
Initial launching x coordinate [1]
y0=
Initial launching y coordinate [0]
u0=
Initial launching u velocity [0]
v0=
Initial launching v velocity [1]
per=
Period, corresponding to the orbit type [3]
type=
Type of orbit {1,2,3} referring to half, full or quarter orbit (in some TDB order) [1]
ome=
Pattern speed of potential [0]
norbit=
Number of extra orbits to compute [1]
step=
Step to increase the non-zero (x or y) position for extra orbits [0.1]

Examples

# henyey:
./henyey 0.6 0 0 1.9 1.0 1 0.0 0 > bench1.log
tabcomment bench1.log | tabplot - 3 4 -1 1 -1 1 line=1,1 yapp=1/xs

# perorb:
perorb phase=0.6,0,0,0,1.89,0 dir=x potname=bar83 potpars=0,1,1,0.2,1 out=o2
orbplot o2 xrange=-1:1 yrange=-1:1 yapp=2/xs

Caveats

For a bar-only model this code has been confirmed to produce the same orbits as perorb(1NEMO) .

Unlike other NEMO orbit related programs, the potential has been hard-coded. The corresponding Makefile makes it relatively easy to plug in another potential. Parameters are passed through FORTRAN common blocks, but again, hard-coded and not available via the command line interface yet, with the exception of the pattern speed.

See Also

perorb(1NEMO) 
1964ApJ...139..306H - A New Method of Automatic Computation of Stellar Evolution.
1982MNRAS.201..303V -  Periodic orbits and gas flow in barred spirals

Ads

@ads 1982MNRAS.201..303V

Author

Tjeerd van Albada, Peter Teuben (NEMO adaptation)
